definition: chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain

sentences.english: As I arrived at the bus stop the driver opened his big manual hinged door.
sentences.chinese: 等我到了巴士站，司机用手拉开那道大铰链门。

sentences.english: A patent-pending hinge secures your Kindle to the cover.
sentences.chinese: 正在申请专利的铰链作保你点燃的封面。

sentences.english: Once its owner has nothing in their account, the hinge simply keeps the wallet shut.
sentences.chinese: 一旦账户里没钱了，铰链直接关闭钱包。

sentences.english: One integral multifunctional machine with the self-locking hinge unit is also provided.
sentences.chinese: 本发明还提供使用该自锁式铰链装置的多功能一体机。

sentences.english: Today's featured workspace sports a hinged compartment for out-of-sight cable stashing.
sentences.chinese: 今天的特色桌面就提供一个基于看不见铰链柜的设备。

sentences.english: I put some oil on the squeaky hinge.
sentences.chinese: 我给锈得吱吱响的铰链上了点油。

sentences.english: The door grated on its rusty hinges .
sentences.chinese: 门因铰链生锈，开门吱吱作响。

sentences.english: CL211: Both right and left open purposed plug type hinge with convenient installation and reasonable structure.
sentences.chinese: 左右门均通用的插销式铰链，安装方便，结构合理。

sentences.english: The guide screw hinge rocking door was the conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 并提出丝杠铰链摇摆门机构新方案。

sentences.english: Use a long rod as hinge axis and stick it through both hinges.
sentences.chinese: 用长杆为铰链轴，并坚持它通过两个铰链。

sentences.english: Use a long rod as hinge axis and stick it through both hinges.
sentences.chinese: 用长杆为铰链轴，并坚持它通过两个铰链。

sentences.english: The British company also fields a line of four track-mounted articulated booms.
sentences.chinese: 而英国公司也对履带铰链式起重臂进行了实地试验。

sentences.english: The view shows the tank with the door assembled with the door seal and hinges welded in place.
sentences.chinese: 该视图显示与组装的门封门坦克和铰链焊接到位。

sentences.english: Cubicle door conjunction pintle that is easy for assemble or unload.
sentences.chinese: 柜门同转轴式活动铰链与构架相连，安装拆卸方便。

definition: door/the opening panel of a door
(of a magnet) to attract metallic objects/(fig.) to exert a magnetic attraction (for investment, tourists etc)
